intro: Galium lucidum var. falcatum, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its leaves and stems are often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
